udpDataXfer

public byte[] udpDataXfer(byte[] header,
                          java.lang.String hostIP,
                          int udpPort,
                          int socketTimeout,
                          int xferLength)
                   throws java.io.IOException
This method performs the actual data transfer, returning the result. It doesn't measure performance, though.

Specified by:
udpDataXfer in interface DataXferInterface.DataXferRawInterface
Parameters:
header - The header to put on the outgoing packet
hostIP - Destination IP address
udpPort - Destination port
socketTimeout - how long to wait for response before giving up
xferLength - The number of data bytes each response packet should carry
Throws:
java.io.IOException

udpDataXferRate

public SampledStatistic.TransferRateInterval udpDataXferRate(byte[] header,
                                                             java.lang.String hostIP,
                                                             int udpPort,
                                                             int socketTimeout,
                                                             int xferLength,
                                                             int nTrials)
Performs nTrials trials via UDP of a data xfer to host hostIP on port udpPort. Expects to get xferLength bytes in total from that host/port. Is willing to wait up to socketTimeout msec. for new data to arrive.

Specified by:
udpDataXferRate in interface DataXferInterface.DataXferRawInterface
Returns:
A TransferRateInterval object that measured the total bytes of data received over all trials and the total time taken. The measured time should include socket creation time.

                          java.lang.String hostIP,
                          int tcpPort,
                          int socketTimeout,
                          int xferLength)
                   throws java.io.IOException
